Package voltage.core

Class VoltageButton

java.lang.Object
voltage.core.VoltageComponent
voltage.core.VoltageButton
Direct Known Subclasses:
VoltageToggle
public class VoltageButton
extends VoltageComponent
Your standard button class.

  • Method Details

    • SetValue

      public void SetValue​(double newValue, boolean bUpdateGUI)
      Sets the button state.
      Overrides:
      SetValue in class VoltageComponent
      Parameters:
      newValue - Use 1.0 to simulate a mouse down on the button. Use 0.0 to restore the button to a normal state.
      bUpdateGUI - A flag to optional change the gui as well.

    • SetValueNoNotification

      public void SetValueNoNotification​(double newValue, boolean bUpdateGUI)
      Sets the button state without sending a notification.
      Overrides:
      SetValueNoNotification in class VoltageComponent
      Parameters:
      newValue - Use 1.0 to simulate a mouse down on the button. Use 0.0 to restore the button to a normal state.
      bUpdateGUI - A flag to optional change the gui as well.

    • ShowOverlay

      public void ShowOverlay​(boolean bShow)
      Do we show the overlay? An overlay can be either text and or an image.
      Parameters:
      bShow - set to true to show the overlay.

    • ShowingOverlay

      public boolean ShowingOverlay()
      Returns true if we are showing the overlay.
      Returns:
      true if showing the overlay.

    • SetImageOverlay

      public void SetImageOverlay​(java.lang.String resourceName)
      Set an image overlay for a button. The image will be displayed for all button states.
      Parameters:
      resourceName - the resource name of an image.

    • GetImageOverlay

      public java.lang.String GetImageOverlay()
      Gets the current image overlay.
      Returns:
      the name of the overlay image.

    • SetButtonStateImageOverlay

      public void SetButtonStateImageOverlay​(java.lang.String resourceName, VoltageButton.ButtonState state)
      Sets the overlay for different button states.
      Parameters:
      resourceName - is the name of the image to use.
      state - is the button state to set the image for.

      Returns:
      the name of the button state image overlay.

      public void SetOverlayArea​(int x, int y, int w, int h)

      Parameters:

      y - the top margin relative to the button.
      w - the width of the overlay.
      h - the height of the overlay.

      fontSize - the size of the font.

    • SetDragMode

      public void SetDragMode​(boolean bDragMode)
      Allows a button to be in drag mode. Drag mode is used in the Eight Step Sequencer. It allows you to click down on a button and drag over other buttons in the same group.
      Parameters:
      bDragMode - set to true to enable drag mode.
